{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3310539,"name":"","username":"VGopal","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-15T23:32:23.656Z","cooked":"

Our team is currently trying to follow this tutorial: Comms/Networking Setup | Limelight Documentation. We are stuck on the step of finding the limelight using the limelight hardware manager. We have installed the latest version of limelight hardware manager, but we haven’t installed the latest image for the limelight (it’s a 2+). Our goal is to install the pre-trained neural network for note detection on the limelight. We were wondering if there are any alternate ways to install a neural network on the limelight?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-15T23:32:23.656Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":79,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":417.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":454907,"topic_slug":"alternate-ways-to-install-neural-networks-on-limelights","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.limelightvision.io/docs/docs-limelight/getting-started/networking","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Comms/Networking Setup | Limelight Documentation","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64293,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/alternate-ways-to-install-neural-networks-on-limelights/454907/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3310610,"name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","username":"KH987","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-16T00:43:17.434Z","cooked":"

How are you physically connected to the limelight? Also, is there a reason you have not updated to the latest firmware? The only way to add the pre trained model is through the limelight web interface once you are connected. If you have a coral plugged into the USB port, you can change the pipeline type to detector and should see buttons that allow you to upload the model.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-16T00:49:13.557Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":26.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":454907,"topic_slug":"alternate-ways-to-install-neural-networks-on-limelights","display_username":"Kevin Hjelstrom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24441,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - 2928"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-ways-to-install-neural-networks-on-limelights/454907/2","custom_user_title":"Mentor - 2928","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3310696,"name":"","username":"VGopal","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-16T02:36:21.587Z","cooked":"
  1. We aren’t physically connected to the limelight, we connected to the robot wifi and used the limelight hardware manager. When we used angry ip scanner, it was able to detect the limelight ip address, but the limelight hardware manager couldn’t. We also used the ping command in powershell and that also worked.
  2. When we tried updating the limelight image, balena etcher couldn’t detect the limelight (we used a usb to usb-c connector).
  3. We have a coral plugged into the limelight.
  4. We use photonvision to detect AprilTags using the limelight, and it is able to stream the video from the limelight to the web interface.
","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-16T02:36:21.587Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":39.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":454907,"topic_slug":"alternate-ways-to-install-neural-networks-on-limelights","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24441,"username":"KH987","name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64293,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/alternate-ways-to-install-neural-networks-on-limelights/454907/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3310724,"name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","username":"KH987","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-16T02:55:54.408Z","cooked":"

If you are using photon vision on the limelight, you will not be able to find it over the hardware manager, nor will you be able to run the object detection model. Both of those features will only work with limelight software on a 2+ as far as I’m aware.

As for your problem with flashing, most of the time it is an issue with the cable being used. I would recommend trying out a different USB-C cable to see if you get a different result.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-16T02:56:55.576Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":57,"readers_count":56,"score":16.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":454907,"topic_slug":"alternate-ways-to-install-neural-networks-on-limelights","display_username":"Kevin Hjelstrom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64293,"username":"VGopal","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/c68b51/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24441,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - 2928"},"post_url":"/t/alternate-ways-to-install-neural-networks-on-limelights/454907/4","custom_user_title":"Mentor - 2928","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3310745,"name":"","username":"VGopal","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-16T03:14:43.072Z","cooked":"

Thanks for your answer! This explains a lot of things. Some follow-up questions I have though is if I don’t want to use photonvision on a limelight, how should I disable it? I did a quick browse of the docs and I can’t seem to find information related to this.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-16T03:14:43.072Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":15.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":454907,"topic_slug":"alternate-ways-to-install-neural-networks-on-limelights","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24441,"username":"KH987","name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64293,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/alternate-ways-to-install-neural-networks-on-limelights/454907/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3310747,"name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","username":"KH987","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-16T03:16:50.300Z","cooked":"

Once you flash new firmware onto it, the existing will no longer be on the device. So in this case, if you download the new image and flash it via balena etcher, you have nothing left you need to do.

Hope this helps!
